subject: Languages
title: Deaf Humor: Comedy Without Sound
description: A 60-second lesson on Deaf Humor: Comedy Without Sound.

hook.text: Deaf humor is a rich tradition â€” and a lot of the jokes are about hearing people.

buildup.text: Visual puns, exaggerated facial expressions, and clever sign play form the basis of deaf comedy.

discovery.text: A classic genre: stories where a deaf person outsmarts a hearing person who underestimated them.

twist.text: Hearing people often miss the humor because it depends on sign language fluency to catch the wordplay.

climax.text: Deaf comedy festivals and YouTube channels have given deaf humor a global audience for the first time.

punchline.text: The funniest language in the world is one most people have never seen performed.

quiz.question: What is a common theme in deaf humor?
options: Deaf people outsmarting hearing people who underestimate them
